title: Music Copyright Specialist
description:
Company Summary:

Orfium is a fast-growing music technology company representing some of the biggest music companies in the world. We are looking for talented, hardworking people to join our rights management team who are passionate about protecting the value of music. Our office is located in Malibu, CA with a beautiful ocean view overlooking the Malibu Pier. Some of our clients include: Warner Music Group, Sony Music Group, Sony/ATV Music Publishing, Warner Chappell Music Publishing, Global Music Rights, Ingrooves, Red Bull, and many more.

Position Summary: The Music Copyrights Specialist is responsible for identifying videos that indicate copyright music/infringement through Youtube’s content management system (CMS). This role requires the analysis of music and revenue data as well staying up to date with industry trends in entertainment. This is a entry-level professional with limited prior experience, but can learn to use professional concepts to resolve problems of limited scope and complexity.
requirements:
Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Employees are expected to acquire the skills and knowledge necessary to perform work necessary for the role through defined training and development planning.
  • Analyze music on a harmonic, melodic, lyrical, and sonic level.
  • Extreme attention to detail, data-driven, excellent communication skills, and a self-starter.
  • Identify videos using copyrighted music through YouTube’s content management system.
  • Support the policing of piracy and copyright infringement by monitoring the unauthorized exploitation of our clients’ copyrights.
  • Remain up to date with industry topics and music.
  • Collect and analyze revenue data to discover valuable content for our clients.
  • Other duties that may be assigned to help the company meet goals.
  • Growth opportunities within this role based on performance
  • Employees should perform at a minimum, milestone 1 for a minimum of 12 months from date of hire as designated by their manager.
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; extremely detail-oriented.
  • Exhibits professional demeanor and sound judgment.
  • Follows up on delegated assignments through completion.
  • Self-starter, who takes initiative and is resourceful; takes ownership of tasks and projects.
  • Ability to adjust to changes of the industry, new guidelines made either internally or by our clients
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize; works well under pressure.
  • Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively.
  • Excellent typing and computer skills, including in Word, Excel, Outlook.
  • Advanced computer experience: Microsoft WordExcel, Internet search, Google trends.
  • Intermediate musical experience with an exceptional ear.
  • High school diploma required, preferred BA or BS degree from an accredited college or university.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position does not directly supervise.

Essential Work & Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.

  • Available to work a minimum of 40 hours per week and a minimum of 5 days per week.
  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.


Orfium is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Mid Backend Software Engineer
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE NEED

We are looking for a Mid Django Backend Engineer to join our Greek branch in Koukaki, Attica.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

You will be part of an Agile Team and will:

  • Maintain as well as build new features for our B2B products.
  • Participate in team meetings and propose solutions.
  • Code Review your collaborators' code(everyone does it).
  • Properly document your work by both technical and/or business perspective.
requirements:
NEEDED SKILLS

  • At least 2-3 years of working experience in creating and maintaining software systems in production environments.
  • At least 1 year of working experience with Django or a modern Web Development Framework.
  • Experience in Test-Driven Development (TDD).
  • Hands-On SQL Experience(preferably with PostgreSQL).
  • Ability to write organised and clean code.
  • Good understanding of Version Control (preferably with Git).
  • Understanding of Modern System Architectures, Design Patterns, Data Structures.
  • Willingness to continuously learn and become better.
  • Ability to work as part of a team.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills in English.


EXTRA POINTS:

  • Expertise in Django/Django REST Framework.
  • Familiarity with AWS.
  • Experience with ElasticSearch.
  • Experience with consuming third-party APIs.
  • Love for music.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
A few things about Orfium

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the media experience. If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Greece, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

A skillful and passionate Senior Product Manager that will manage two of our main B2B products that focus on centralizing music usage in various formats and music industry standards, provided by various media platforms, digital service providers, and other licensees. The other aspect of these products is the matching process of this music usage against a defined dataset (repertoire) by utilizing machine learning algorithms based on complicated metadata matching procedures.

We are looking for a candidate with a good understanding of enterprise software, a data-driven mindset, and the management of a product lifecycle.

The ideal candidate will have a startup mindset along with analytical thinking skills and will be willing to take initiatives and execute the product strategy effectively and report back with ideas that will improve our Product Suite and Operations.

  • Work along with the Unit Director of Products for high-level requirements
  • Collaborate with the Product and Design Team to build and deliver a Product Roadmap
  • Analyze business requirements and prioritize tickets for the relevant teams
  • Incorporate feedback from customers and business into the product strategy
  • Develop a long-term vision and strategy for your products
  • Monitor the performance of products
  • Deep dive into the music industry standards
  • Collaborate with Tech Leaders in order to achieve deadlines and deliver products efficiently
  • Align with the Operations department in order to locate any possible issues and deficiencies
  • Explore opportunities for new products, new business models and prepare the roadmap for new versions of existing products
requirements:

  • Proven experience as a product manager or product owner
  • Proven knowledge of Agile methodologies
  • Passion for innovation and impact
  • Good design perception
  • Strong written and verbal Greek and English communication skills


EXTRA POINTS:

  • Love for music!
  • Agile certifications
  • An academic background in computer science, or proven programming skills
  • Previous experience in a startup company
  • Familiarity with Programming Languages and Frameworks (Python, Django framework, React Framework, and more)
  • Experience in Big Data, Analytics, or Payment projects or products
  • MBA or Master in Business

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Company Summary:

Position Summary: The Senior Accountant is responsible for maintaining the general ledger, managing the accounts payable function, and processing payroll. This role also works closely with the Accounting Manager to support monthly, quarterly, half year, and year-end financial close and the preparation of financial reports as requested by management.

Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Manage all activities in the accounts payable function including the invoice approval process, timely payment of vendor invoices, and accurate posting of transactions from the bank feed and credit cards.
  • Maintain accurate records over the general ledger including monthly bank, credit card and account reconciliations to identify and correct any errors.
  • Process payroll and invoices in HRIS for all employees and contractors.
  • Assist in the onboarding of new employees and contractors.
  • Compile, analyze and report financial information to management and government agencies.
  • Develop, implement and maintain systems, policies, and procedures within the accounts payable function to ensure adherence to company guidelines, department budgets, and internal controls.
  • Provide accounting assistance to project managers and operations staff; respond to financial questions/concerns to meet business needs.
  • Support timely monthly, quarterly, half-year, and year-end financial close and preparation of financial statements, including journal entries, account reconciliations, accruals, and overall maintenance of all operational management accounts.
  • Prepare financial reports as requested by management by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends primarily within Accounts Payable.
  • Maintain vendor records and perform 1099 filings on an annual basis.
  • Develop processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
  • Assist with audits and tax returns.
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.
requirements:
Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in accounting, finance or related major.
  • Minimum 2 years of accounting experience (experience in public accounting preferred).
  • Advanced MS Excel skills including, but not limited to Vlookups and pivot tables.
  • CPA is preferred.
  • In-depth understanding of GAAP, financial reporting, corporate finance principles and accounts payable procedures.
  • Experience with QuickBooks, Sage Intacct, Expensify, and Adaptive Planning or similar systems.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; extremely detail-oriented.
  • Commitment to ethical behavior.
  • Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical, multitasking, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to analyze information and processes.
  • Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
  • Stay up to date with guidelines set by Orfium, the clients and industry partners.
  • Experience in the entertainment industry with knowledge of accounting for royalties is a plus.
  • Knowledge of computer programming languages (i.e. Python, VBA) also a plus.

This position does not supervise.
